sentence: Also, P&G has an excellent track record of returning value to shareholders.
Over the past five years the company, returned $60 billion through dividends and share buybacks, and $11.9 billion in fiscal 2015 alone.
The next four years, including 2016, the company plans to dish out up to $70 billion to shareholders.
P&G, given its leading brands, vast resources, and scale, will continue to be an absolutely critical partner for retailers across the world.

While the company faces headwinds now with foreign currency exchange and never-ending product innovation demand, it's a safe stock for any portfolio, and upside remains for long-term investors willing to wait out its portfolio transformation.

The world's biggest tech company forgot to show you something, but a few Wall Street analysts and the Fool didn't miss a beat: There's a small company that's powering their brand-new gadgets and the coming revolution in technology.
And we think its stock price has nearly unlimited room to run for early in-the-know investors!
To be one of them, just click here .
